topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54854de06368722b83f00000#post_54854de06368722b83f00000
On the other hand there's been recent attacks on geeks and apparently there was a gas attack on furfest.  If someone has problems with geeks they're allowed to have their opinions, but gas attacks are crossing the line.

Obviously the gas attack doesn't have anything to do with gamergate, but the anti-geek movement has gone way to far when they're willing to gas people.  If someone doesn't like geeks that's all fine and good, but gassing people is not morally acceptable or legal.  The people at furfest were lucky the person responsible was a dumbass and didn't know chemical warfare, cause otherwise that would have ended really badly.  Those 19 people that were hospitalized are lucky to be alive.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

But you don't agree with how the SJWs do things. Right?

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54854f936368722716dc0000#post_54854f936368722716dc0000
Chlorine gas, right?

Even though these attacks happened to the other branches of geek culture. Do you find it suspicious that these anti-Geek activities and SJW activities by pseudo-feminists have increased lately since around the time of GG's existence?

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548550906368722c98740100#post_548550906368722c98740100
Yeah.

Over the past couple of months anti-geeks have carried out at least a hundred cyber terrorist attacks and now there's a actual terrorist attack.  Obviously this doesn't have to do with gamergate, *BUT* the anti-geek movement is quickly becoming a actual terrorist movement.  I would not be surprised at all if the anti-geek movement in five years is just a front for a terrorist organization.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548551a36368722760920100#post_548551a36368722760920100
I know some SJWs have been involved in these cyber-attacks. But it could be just anyone with loose morals. Furries have made many enemies from all over, including among themselves. However, SJWs have somewhat become a primary suspects since the GG movement. I know these kind of things happened in the past before, but not at the rate it has been in this decade 2010-present.

Whoever did this, I hope they're caught.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54854fe26368722d93340100#post_54854fe26368722d93340100
 I think they sometimes have legitimate points that people should atleast listen to. BUUUUUT. They have the worst ways of saying things, tend to act like bigots themselves, and ussually are just rude as hell. So no. Do not care for them.

I just have issue with the gaming community cause they bicker alot and seem to be rude to each other so much. Over games. I don't think I  want to be a part of that. 

Don't take that to mean I'd be an ass to someone cause they are a gamer either. That would be just rude and being a horrible human being.

Nor do I place the gaming community at the levels of SJW. At most the gaming community irritates me, but it's their thing. They're doing what they want, Doing and talking about what they love, what ignites their passions. I may not like the arguing that goes on, but it is ultimately harmless.

SJW...seem to tend to spread hate.

Big difference.




"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54854f936368722716dc0000#post_54854f936368722716dc0000
Yeah I heard about that. There's a difference between being a hater and hate crime. That goes into hate crime. The fuck is wrong with them?
That is, assuming it wasn't an accident. It hasn't been verified yet.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5485540063687225b6e60100#post_5485540063687225b6e60100
It was a intentional gassing; not much is known about who did it but the thing that is known is that it was a intentional attack.  Eventually information will come out, but the thing we do know is that it was 100% intentional.

Before someone says something; no there's no such thing as a accidental terrorist chemical attack.  "I don't know officer; I just had these dangerous chemicals and whoops I accidentally mixed them together and accidentally created a dangerous chemical and accidentally transported it to somewhere else, accidentally spent a month planning it, accidentally picked optimal location and accidentally released it"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5485540063687225b6e60100#post_5485540063687225b6e60100
To many, it's never about justice they wanted but personal gains. For others, they're doing it in a misguided manner.

It happened during midnight, probably when most people were sleeping. It could've been worse. Fortunately, no casualties. The act was 'intentional'. I'm just glad the hotel was quick to act.

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548556d46368722a07040200#post_548556d46368722a07040200
It's had like fifty different names, but it's pretty much the same thing.  At first it was "D&D is the work of satan" then it was "Video games are the work of satan" then it was "Anime is the work of satan" and so forth.

It's like the anti-sex movement; they always claim to not be against the thing they're trying to ban and whenever they lose popularity they resurface as a "new(tm)" movement, but it's always the same shit just with a different name.
